io.craigmiller160.stockmarket.controller

Class SQLPortfolioDAO

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.craigmiller160.stockmarket.controller.SQLPortfolioDAO
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PortfolioDAO, java.beans.PropertyChangeListener, java.util.EventListener

    @NotThreadSafe
public class SQLPortfolioDAO
extends java.lang.Object
implements PortfolioDAO, java.beans.PropertyChangeListener
    Implementation of a data access object for accessing a SQL database where stock portfolios are saved. Because it saves and loads the state of the implementation of this program, it is dependent on the implementations of the AbstractStock class, and cannot use AbstractStock as an abstraction layer. Specifically, it depends on the Stock and OwnedStock classes. Any major changes made to these classes will need to be reflected in this class as well.

    This implementation works with a MySQL database, and currently only allows a single thread to access the database at a time. This poses virtually no performance issues, as the database is only used infrequently to save and load the program's total state. This can be changed in future versions if database use needs to be expanded.

    Lastly, this class can have PropertyChangeListeners added to it. Any listeners that are added will be added to the PortfolioModel instances that are created by the methods herein. This allows the models to update the GUI as their properties are being set by this class. In order to simplify the process of adding the listeners, this class doubles as a PropertyChangeListener and is added to the models as a listener when they are created. Any events received by this class are merely passed along to external listeners.

    Listeners added to a model while inside of this class are removed from that model before it is released from this class.

    THREAD SAFETY: This class has no mutable state, with the only changing values being thread local values passed to this class's methods. However, due to the current restriction on only one thread accessing the database at a time, this class should generally only be used by one thread at a time. If this restriction is lifted in future versions, this class is already properly constructed for concurrent access.

    Version:
    2.0
    Author:
    craig
    See Also:
    OwnedStock, Stock

    • Constructor Detail

      • SQLPortfolioDAO

        public SQLPortfolioDAO()
                throws java.io.IOException
        Constructs this controller by loading the database properties from file and configuring access permits through a Semaphore object. If it is unable to load the database properties, an exception is thrown and this object fails to be completely constructed.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the database properties cannot be loaded.

      • getPortfolio

        public PortfolioModel getPortfolio(java.lang.String fileName)
                            throws java.lang.InterruptedException,
                                   java.sql.SQLException
        Returns a portfolio loaded from the data source that matches the specified file name. NOTE: if the file name string does not match the expected file name format, an exception will be thrown. To avoid this, this method should maintain an explicit contract with getSavedPortfolios(). The file name parameter here should be a perfect match to the format of the strings in the list returned by that method.
        Specified by:
        getPortfolio in interface PortfolioDAO
        Parameters:
        fileName - the file name of the portfolio.
        Returns:
        the portfolio loaded from the data source.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if an error occurs while trying to access the database.
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if a thread is interrupted while waiting on database access.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the parameter is not a valid value.
        See Also:
        SQLPortfolioDAO.getSavedPortfolios()

      • savePortfolio

        public void savePortfolio(PortfolioModel portfolio)
                   throws java.lang.InterruptedException,
                          java.sql.SQLException
        Saves the portfolio to the data source for storing its values between program sessions.

        THREAD SAFETY: A copy of the syncStockList parameter is made before working on it. However, the OwnedStock objects the copy contains are the same references in the original list. This method makes no changes to the state of any of the OwnedStock objects, and any changes to this method should maintain this.

        Specified by:
        savePortfolio in interface PortfolioDAO
        Parameters:
        portfolio - the portfolio to be saved.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if an error occurs while trying to access the database.
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if a thread is interrupted while waiting for database access.

      • propertyChange

        public void propertyChange(java.beans.PropertyChangeEvent event)
        This method is merely used to pass PropertyChangeEvents to outside listeners. This mechanic is used to allow PortfolioModels that are being constructed by this class to have their attributes passed to the view as they are set.
        Specified by:
        propertyChange in interface java.beans.PropertyChangeListener
        Parameters:
        event - the PropertyChangeEvent to pass to outside listeners.
